snippet: After decades of decline, the energy and focus at this week’s A.F.L.-C.I.O. convention signaled, as one union president put it, “our need to put some movement back in the labor movement.”
abstract: Energy and focus at this week’s AFL-CIO convention, following decades of decline, signals, as one union president put it, 'need to put some movement back in the labor movement;' federation of 57 labor unions invited scores of nonunion groups to four-day convention to brainstorm about organized labor's future.
lead_paragraph: After decades of decline, the energy and focus at this week’s A.F.L.-C.I.O. convention signaled, as one union president put it, “our need to put some movement back in the labor movement.”

headline.main: At Labor Group, a Sense of a Broader Movement
headline.print_headline: At Labor Group, a Sense Of a Broader Movement

keywords.value: American Federation of Labor-Congress of Industrial Organizations
